[The communication wh: I at present make 
to the Society is part of the results of a series of observations 
wh: I have been carrying on for some years 
past. My object at first was to procure 
some method of manipulation by which the 
course of the fibrous matter of the brain could 
be easily & conclusively demonstrated and through 
wh: the grey matter might be readily differentiated 
from the white. By long experimenting I have 
at last discovered a process by wh: this can 
be accomplished. Method is published in full 
in “Brain” for July 1883, and it will be accordingly un-
necessary <s>on this account <\s> to say anything further 
of this at present. I would merely state that 
where the brain is hardened by the method 
I have recommended the examination of <s>[text?]<\s> 
an opaque section made roughly through the 
organ simply with a long flat knife often yields 
most valuable information. I specially recommend 
such <s>macroscopic <\s> opaque views of the brain 
structure to be taken along with such as are 
obtained when the preparation is clarified <s>by the clarification accomplished <\s> by
the means which I have described in the above paper.
Some sets of fibres can be seen actually better 
in this opaque condition than when a [text?]
thin section is made by a graduated <s>[text?]<\s> instrument.
